Name: Battle for the South China Sea
Description:
Battle for the South China Sea is a two-player board-wargame that investigates a potential Chinese drive to take control of Southeast and Eastern Asia through force in the near future. Each player must contend with the delicate political balance in the region with an uncertain and unstable political landscape. Once the conflict begins the Chinese player must balance focusing their forces against the scope of their ambitions, including potential control of the first and second “island chains”. The US player must manage a disparate, political unstable alliance where each country is concerned with their own security. Combat takes place on land and at sea, with the various airpower, missile, air denial, and sea denial systems of the regional powers influencing the outcome.

Planned for publication with Modern War #57.
However Modern War stopped being published in 2021 and last issue was #55

(description from the publisher and user's comments)

Name: Wup di Wup
Description:
The players use the springboard to flip the "Federhopfer" onto the game bord and score or lose the indicated points. The points are marked by pins on the top of the game board. The first player to score 100 points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Dad Joke Face-Off After Dark
Description:
In Dad Joke Face-Off After Dark — a "not-safe-for-work" follow up to the party game Dad Joke Face-Off! — players sit face to face and take turns telling jokes. Read a dad joke off of your card and do so WITHOUT SMILING OR LAUGHING, while trying to get your opponent to crack. Sounds simple? Get your friends together for a grown-up game night and see who laughs — or doesn't laugh — the most!

Continue to face off with other opponents to see who has the best (or worst) sense of humor with the (kinda dirty) game you can't help but laugh at!
Families: Versions & Editions: Adult Versions of Family-Friendly Games

Name: Dad Joke Face-Off 2nd Ed
Description:
Get ready for the 2nd edition of the popular game with the best worst jokes you've ever heard! Inspired by the hit internet sensation, this hysterical party game will test your ability to make others laugh or stop yourself from doing so.  We've all groaned or rolled our eyes after hearing ""dad jokes"" before, but, when the pressure is on, can you stop yourself from laughing or even cracking a smile?

In Dad Joke Face-Off, two players sit face to face and take turns telling jokes. Read a Dad Joke off of your card and do so WITHOUT SMILING OR LAUGHING, while trying to get your opponent to crack. Sounds pretty simple? Don't take our word for it, get your friend and family together and see who laughs... or doesn't laugh the most!

When a player smiles or laughs, their opponent gives them a ""Made you laugh"" card. The player with the least Made you laugh cards wins the round. Continue to Face Off with other opponents to see who has the best (or worst) sense of humor with the game you can't help but laugh at!

—description from the publisher

Name: LookSee
Description:
LookSee is a fast paced visual perception game where players simultaneously compete to win a card. Roll the dice, figure out the missing number and color, then race the other players to find the object that matches that on the card! You find it, you grab it! When taking a Looksee at the two dice, determine if the numbers and colors are either all alike or all different. Then find the missing attirbute and players must race to find the item on the card that shows up in that color the exact times of the number.  For example, if the two dice are both blue and both number 2, then players must find the item pictured twice in blue on the card (all alike).  If the two dice are blue and green, and show the numbers 1 and 2, then players must find the item pictured red three times on the card (all different).

—description from the publisher

Name: Burger Academy
Description:
Some people think flipping burgers is pretty easy — but can you flip this burger?

In Burger Academy, use your bid cards to bid the number of "steps" it will take to form the burger exactly as it appears on the card. Foam burger pieces start the round stacked in three piles, and a step takes place when a player flips the pieces in one stack, moves one or more pieces to another stack, or does a combination move.

Burger Academy features multiple levels of difficulty and solitaire play.

Name: Flowers
Description:
Create your own flowerbed, there are reds, yellows, whites and blues! But watch out for goats, lawnmowers, tornadoes ... and the wickedness of your opponents!
The aim of the game is to win the game by planting 6 flowers of the same color first in your flowerbed.

PREPARATION and VICTORY
Shuffle the deck and place it face down in the center of the table.
During the game, the discard pile (cards played) and the market area will be placed on the sides of the deck
(where you will find the flowers you have caught and which cannot be used in your flower bed).
The youngest player starts the game by drawing the top card.
The game ends when a player completes his flowerbed with six FLOWERS of the same color. If there are no more cards to draw: take all the cards from the discards, from the market and from ALL the warehouses, mix them and continue the game, repeat this operation until there is a winner.

Each player during his turn can only perform ONE action from the following:

- Draw a card from the deck showing it to everyone, if the card is the first flower to be drawn, it must be placed in front of it, forming its own flowerbed, otherwise if the flower is of a different color from the one planted in its row, it must be positioned in the market area.
If you lose one or all the flowers in your flowerbed, due to GOAT or LAWNMOWER cards, you can continue with different flowers from the previous one, by fishing or buying it on the market at the cost of 3 COINS.
The other Moneta, Lawnmower and Goat cards must be placed next to your flowerbed to form a row that we will call the warehouse, and played whenever you want, in a subsequent turn, when you decide not to draw a card.
If you draw a TORNADO card it must be played immediately.

- Use a card from your warehouse: GOAT or GRASS CUTTER to eat flowers from your opponents or COINS to buy a FLOWER card from the market.

Name: Robots
Description:
Create your Robot, there are several models. But watch out for the devastating robot and its gang, dynamite ... and the wickedness of your opponents!
The aim of the game is to win the game by building your own Robot first with 1 Head, 1 Bust, 1 Left Arm, 1 Right Arm, 1 Left Leg, 1 Right Leg.

PREPARATION and VICTORY
Shuffle the deck and place it face down in the center of the table.
During the game, the discard pile (cards played) and the market area (where the Robot-components you have drawn and which cannot be used for your Robot) will be placed on the sides of the deck.
The youngest player starts the game by drawing the top card.
The game ends when a player completes his Robot with the six required Robot-Component cards. If there are no more cards to draw: take all the cards from the discards, from the market and from ALL the deposits, shuffle them and continue the game, repeat this operation until there is a winner.

GAME TURN
Each player during his turn can only perform ONE action from the following:

- Draw a card from the deck showing it to everyone, if the card is a Robot-Component that you don't have, it must be placed in front of you
going to train your Robot, otherwise if it is a Robot-Component you already own, it must be positioned in the market area.
If you lose one or all of the components of your Robot, due to MINI ROBOT DEVASTATOR or BAND of MINI ROBOTS DEVASTATORI cards, you can continue with different components from the previous one, by fishing or buying them on the market at the cost of 3 BOLTS.
The other cards: Bolt, Guard Robot, Mini Robot Devastator and Band of Mini Robots Devastators, must be positioned to the side of your Robot to form an area that we are going to call deposit, and played when you want, in a subsequent turn, when you decide not to draw a card or when you are attacked by an opponent.
If you draw the DYNAMITE card it must be played immediately.

- Use one card from your warehouse: MINI ROBOT DEVASTATOR or BAND of MINI ROBOTS DEVASTATORI to distract the Robot from the opponents or three BOLT cards to purchase a ROBOT-COMPONENTS card from the market.

Name: "500" Cribbage
Description:
Fully referred to as the "500 Cribbage Thomas System", this game sets out to develop and modernize the classic game of Cribbage with several refinements.

Players peg points on an updated version of the original Cribbage board, with separate tracks for points scored in the Play, Hand, and Crib. Additionally, the straight-flush is recognized as an independent scoring combination, and the play of the cards until "Go" is extended to a limit of 34 instead of 31. Equal deals are played (5 each) and at the end players total their scores: points from the Play are worth 6, from the Hand 4, and from the Crib 3. If the loser failed to reach a grand total of 500, their deficit is added to the winner's final score (relevant in series play).

The most significant change is the board. The "500" Cribbage board includes, for each player: two tracks to 30 labeled "Play" and "Crib", one double-track to 60 labeled "Hand", a bank of additional pegs and 30/60/120 holes to mark if any of those tracks are exceeded, and a 5-hole track for each player to mark the number of deals. The game thus cannot be played on a classic Cribbage board, but classic Cribbage can be played on the "500" board by using the eight tracks for up to four players.

Included within the rules are variants for solitaire play, four players in partnerships, and a spinoff betting game called "Cribbage Poker".

Name: Velká výhra
Description:
3 to 5 players compete to get rich as quickly as possible in this game from Communist Czechoslovakia.

A single pawn is moved around the game board, based on dice rolls. Before each roll, all players can put some (or all or none) of their funds into the bank as a bet. Based on the roll, the pawn is moved (with possible re-rolls) and the color where the pawn lands determines what happens to everyone's bets. This can have varying results, including "lose all money in the bank", "win 10x your bet" or even "lose all money NOT currently in the bank".

This may sound like a game of pure chance but there is some strategy involved because of the re-rolls, the distribution of colors on the board (e.g. at any given moment, there is higher probability of pawn ending its turn on color X and not on any other color) and the changing order in which the players place their bets.

The winner is the first player to own 1,000,000 of "Game Crowns" (fake money).

Name: Gesucht wird ...
Description: Gesucht wird ... is an interesting and educational guessing game for quick thinkers and sniffers or those who want to become one. All players form a team and together guess the biblical person they are looking for. It can be very exciting because the hourglass continues to run. Whichever player ends up ahead, everyone will ultimately gain more Bible knowledge.

Name: The Great Outdoors Game
Description: A roll-and-move trivia game with various questions about hunting, fishing, and wildife.

Name: Killer Party: Kiss of Death
Description:
Who murdered the reality show bride? Compete against your friends to solve this celebrity crime in Killer Party’s Kiss of Death! Six to twelve amateur sleuths can play this whodunit party game. To crack the case, collect Clue Cards and use your deductive skills to piece together the events of the crime. But there’s one catch: the only way to get a Clue Card is by performing a crazy stunt! What will you do to get a clue? You and your fellow detectives work your way through three envelopes, until someone solves the case! Sure to get increasingly wacky and hilarious, Killer Party is equal parts fun and challenging! You must use your deductive reasoning and strategic thinking in order to score points and find the bride’s killer! At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins! In the event of a tie, you’ll have to take on another mystery – like Killer Party’s Fangs for the Memories! Will you be the one to crack the case? Test your sleuthing skills with Killer Party’s Kiss of Death: the social mystery party game!

—description from the publisher

Name: FutureShock!
Description:
FUTURESHOCK has arrived, and with it, come brutality, mayhem and carnage, all on a single page that can be printed out, cut and turned into a tiny six-page booklet. FS is a set of incredibly simple skirmish rules for miniatures in your collection, focused on the post-apocalypse, but don't let that stop you from using it to fit whatever setting you prefer.

In FS, players create warbands of thrashers and send them into small-scale engagements, rife with blood, mayhem and slaughter. Skirmishes are played on 1 by 1 foot battlefields with combat beginning on the very first turn.

This inaugural issue of FS contains the complete core rules in a simple tiny booklet, with future installments to focus on: solitaire rules, scenarios, new weapons and items, mutations and much more.

Welcome to the wasteland, Thrasher.

Welcome, to FUTURESHOCK!

—description from the publisher

Name: Gloomhaven: Assault on the Morning Star (Promo Scenario)
Description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven.

The scenario was made available as a reward for backing the Dice Tower Kickstarter 2020 campaign.

Name: Rugby: The Game – Substitution Expansion
Description:
The substitution pack adds a whole new dimension to Rugby: The Game. RTG plays great as the base game, but adding subs creates an exciting new dynamic to really get the adrenaline pumping.

Firstly we have the Star players. Two full teams of them! These guys are on another level, with better stats and a few player-specific abilities that give them the edge. The overall gameplay is still pretty balanced, but played right, you know when these guys are on the field!

The players can only come on when you use one of your substitution cards (generally 5 in a game). These cards have rules which dictate when they can be used, and are determined by points-difference, total points scored, game stage (such as "play at half time"), and such. Also, the player is randomly selected (with the subs card dictating "Forward" or "Back" deck only), so you don't know who you will get. Oh, the anticipation is already killing me!

-description from publisher

Name: Gloomhaven: Memories of Gloomhaven (Promo Scenario)
Description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven.

The scenario was available as part of the 2019 No Pun Included Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Battle for the Planets
Description:
Battle for the Planets is a fun fast paced game that has you and your friends scrambling to match cards and claim planets.

The aim of the game is collect three cards but to sabotage your opponents at the same time. First player to collect all three cards wins, once you yell out the planet's name, victory is yours!

Each game is a bit different as each planet card you are trying to get has a different game rule. Action cards also spice up the gameplay, adding new strategies and tactics. Will you save up your 'steal' cards to take players' cards, or discard them to get a new card?

Every game is unique with 30 planet cards with different game modifiers. What are you waiting for? Battle for the planets!

—description from the designer

Name: Gloomhaven: Twilight of the Lost Cabal (Promo Scenario)
Description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven.

The scenario was available as part of the 2020 Secret Cabal Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Color Coordinated
Description:
In Color Coordinated, players take turns playing matching colors or effects, building up a big pile of cards! If a player cannot or chooses not to play a matching card, the previous player gets all of the cards in the pile added to their hand! Beware though, the bigger the hand, the bigger the target as players will play effects to reduce cards in your hand and add to theirs!

Each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards and the remaining deck is then shuffled and placed in the center of the playing area.

The player who is wearing one of the game's four colors will go first. The beginning player can play any card to start and the card's effect must be followed. Players will then begin to play a matching color OR matching effect. This cycle continues until a player has no matching color or effect, OR chooses not to play a matching card or effect. The previous player then receives all of the played face-up cards to their hand.

The player with the biggest hand when the deck runs out, or when a player reaches 21 cards, wins!

-description from designer

Name: Gem Hunt
Description:
Theme:

Gem Hunt is an open-world, adventure tabletop board game for 1-4 players. Set out on your trek as one of 12 unique Gem Hunters. You travel across the board which contains a diverse number of regions and locations that have unique opportunities and dangers as you set out to complete your quests and become the Master Gem Hunter!

Quests are unique jeweled items that contain specific numbers and types of faceted gems and pearls and have a monetary value once all the components are collected and turned in at the jeweler’s.  There are 50 unique quest cards that can consist of diamonds, rubies, emeralds, sapphires, topaz, opals, and various pearls.

Rough gems and pearls are obtained on unique locations on the board. Rough gems need to be cut into faceted gems to count toward completing your quest. There are some other opportunities to acquire gems and pearls in the game which gives players the opportunity to take a chance on finding an alternate means towards their goal.

Gem Town is the central hub of the island nation of Pacifica, which contains various locations visited throughout the game.  The island also has a mountain region, jungle region, and desert region; which are interconnected and accessible via rope bridges.  Each movement space visited requires the player to draw a fate card which can be beneficial to the player or a dire challenge.  There are 100 unique fates and 240 fate cards in total.

Goal:

At the beginning of each game the players decide whether to play a game based on completing the most quest cards in a specific time frame (first to achieve a specific total value in completed quest cards) or a speed round, which is the first player to complete one quest card.

Gameplay:

Gem Hunt uses a turn-based, card drawing, and die rolling game system. Every turn has a movement phase and an action phase. The movement phase can consist of crossing a rope bridge, taking a ferry, taking the underground railway, taking a ride on a zip line, or moving on the board on one of the regional movement spaces. The action phase can consist of mining for gems, digging for oysters, cutting rough gems into faceted gems, performing transactions in the appropriate location, turning in completed quest cards, playing one of the mini games, or drawing a fate card after landing on a regional movement space. There are certain situations where additional movement or actions can be taken on your turn but those are detailed within the instructions.

—description from publisher

Name: War of 1812: The Later Battles
Description:
War of 1812 - the Later Battles is the second of three low complexity wargames covering the major battles of the war between Imperial Great Britain and the still young democracy of the United States of America.

This set contains everything needed to play the 14 battle scenarios for the period from mid 1813 to the end of the war. The battles covered are : Big Sandy Creek, Black Rock, Bladensburg, Caulk’s Field, Chippawa, Cook’s Mill, Cryslers Farm*, Hampstead Hill, Lacolle Mills, Longwoods, Lundy’s Lane*, Mackinac Island, North Point and Plattsburgh.


     The battles have been revised and expanded from the originals in War of 1812 Battle Collection


Box includes die cut 5/8" counters, battle specific maps, terrain chart, rules and scenarios booklet.

-description from publisher

Name: Exploding Kittens: Barking Kittens
Description:
This is the Third Expansion of Exploding Kittens

It includes 20 new cards, instructions, and a wearable "Tower of Power" cat crown

Name: Bad Koalas
Description:
The Koaladay Parade has gotten out of hand! Instead of marching peacefully to the forest the koalas are now starting to gather in the city and riot!

Bad Koalas is fully-cooperative, which means players win or lose as a team. Only one player takes a turn at a time, but they may solicit feedback from other players.

• The deck contains of 4 different colors (types) of koalas.
• The play area is communal for all players. It consists of four columns, one for each koala type. The horizontal row of 4 zones at the bottom of each column is collectively called the City; each koala that enters play from the deck is placed into the city zone that corresponds to that koala’s color.
• Koalas are unhappy in the city; when too many of them end a turn in the same city zone, they riot, which leads to problems for the players.
• The center row above the City is called the Country. Koalas in the country are relatively happy and therefore don’t riot like the koalas in the city.
• The row of zones at the top of each column is called the forest; players want to advance koalas to the forest to score them (flip them over) and gain upgraded action powers that the happy koalas in the forest grant you.
• Above the play area are the 4 action cards that each player can choose from on their turn. Each action is dedicated to moving koalas up toward the forest zones. (The koala token must be moved to a different action card each turn; you can’t select the same action that was chosen the previous turn.)
• On their turn, the active player moves the koala token to the action card of their choice, resolves that action, and then places into the city zones the (2+) new koalas that automatically come out of the deck... and resolves any riots that ensue as a result. Then the next player in clockwise turn order takes their turn. The game ends immediately when players win or lose together.

All players win immediately if at any time all koalas have been cleared from the city and country zones.

All players lose if either of the following conditions are met:
• if there are 15 or more koalas in the city zones
• if the koala deck is empty when a card is required to be drawn

-description from publisher

Name: Trivia by the Pound: Music
Description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on music.
Families: Series: Trivia By The Pound (Rumba Games)

Name: Trivia by the Pound: Movies Trivia Game
Description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on movies.
Families: Series: Trivia By The Pound (Rumba Games)

Name: Trivia by the Pound: Christmas Trivia Game
Description:
CHRISTMAS - 'Tis the season! What better time to engage in a game of Christmas trivia than when the family's gathered together for the holidays? Learn all bout Yuletide lore through the centuries, from the Three Kings to King Wenceslas, St. Nicholas to Sinterklaas, Ebenezer Scrooge to Frosty the Snowman.

Categories test your knowledge of: Carols, Movies, The North Pole, Traditions and Stocking Stuffers.

Includes 1,200 trivia questions, pencils and score pads.

-description from the back of the box
Families: Series: Trivia By The Pound (Rumba Games)

Name: Trivia by the Pound: Big Screen
Description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on the Big Screen.
Families: Series: Trivia By The Pound (Rumba Games)

Name: Trivia by the Pound: Small Screen
Description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on the Small Screen.
Families: Series: Trivia By The Pound (Rumba Games)

Name: Trivia by the Pound: Television Trivia Game
Description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on television.
Families: Series: Trivia By The Pound (Rumba Games)

Name: Defender
Description:
Launch your Defender Space Craft from it's docking bay and race to the Ion Field! There you will retrieve Ion Generators, one at a time, and transport them back to your docking bay to install in your circuit board. Watch out for aliens and don't crash, otherwise you will have to return to a repair station or your docking bay before continuing your mission.

The first player to complete a circuit board by installing three different colored Ion Generators is the victor in this space-themed spin-and-move children's game.

—user summary

Name: Foundations of Rome: Gardens of Ceres
Description:
The goddess Ceres is saddened by the destruction of nature to make way for Rome’s foundations. In her wisdom, she has petitioned her followers to erect lavish gardens to ensure Rome does not forget from whence they came, and bring balance to the budding city’s creation.

The goddess may even elect to tamper further with the city’s construction, should she see wisdom in it…

But the city must grow, and you must enact our King’s will, even if it means building around these gardens.

A smart AI opponent that would react to your building placements and attempt to outmaneuver the player with special powers.

Name: Ultimate Frisbee: The Board Game
Description:
In a rivalry that pits team Ocean vs team Fire, Ultimate Frisbee: The Board Game brings ultimate frisbee home.

The goal of the game is the score 3 touchdowns first. Touchdowns are scored by completing passes to teammates and moving down the field for an ending pass being caught in the endzone.

Following a chess like style in movement, the team on offense utilizes different cards from their hand to attempt passes. Different passing options include a backhand, forehand, swing, and dump pass. Both offensive and defensive players can also utilize speed boost and dive cards that can make all the difference from a defended pass to a completed touchdown.

This board game presents an option to play real-time ultimate, where strategy, and a bit of luck will be needed to put you over the top.

—description from the designer

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Elder Shoggoth
Description:
The Ultimate Terror! The Elder Shoggoth allows you to evolve one of your units into any other unit to and including a Great Old One!

CW-U31, part of the Cthulhu Wars: Daemon Sultan Final Onslaught Kickstarter.

Name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 01
Description:
What happens when five of wargaming’s most talented indie designers are teamed up with an incredible graphic artist?

The answer is a unique anthology project. New rules for your favourite indie titles. New games ripped right from the minds of wargaming’s most prolific collective of published writers and insights into the process of writing and creating games.

Join us for BLASTER!

BLASTER: Volume 1 contains:


     Martian Racing Federation, a stand-alone game-mode for Gaslands by Mike Hutchinson. You’ve seen Earth's worst, now witness their overlords.
     Last Days: TIMELINES by Ash Barker, which takes the Zombie Apocalypse through time; beginning with the Old West. 
     The Lotus Guilds of the Twilight Seat spring onto the scene in Relic Blade by Sean Sutter along with downloadable assets for these new Seekers. 
     The Beastmasters, a whole new faction for THIS IS NOT A TEST by Joseph McGuire. With complete rules for these maniac pet-owners in the Wasteland.
     Rangers of the Watchtower, a complete mission supplement from Rangers of Shadowdeep by Joseph McCullough that reimagines the game with a fellowship. 
     Closing thoughts from all five designers on this first volume and the state of wargaming.


—description from the publisher

This PDF document presents print-and-play expansion modules for five miniatures games, noted above.
—user summary

Name: Birds & Bees: A Co-operative Tilt Game
Description:
A co-operative boardgame in which players tilt the playboard back and forth on the wooden tilt-block to move the "birds" and "bees" marbles into their respective nests, flowers and bee hives. An educational game intended to touch upon the basics of reproduction, it includes four variant sets of rules as well.

—user summary

Name: Let's Make Pizza
Description:
A cooperative tile-based game which has successive turns, but requires players to prepare their ingredients in such a way as to maximise the production by the next player following them. Everybody is making pizzas, while making sure the oven doesn't get too hot and burn any pizzas which would risk ending the game as a collective loss. Includes Red dot, Green dot and Yellow dot tiles for various age levels.

—user summary

Name: Speedy Parcel
Description:
A co-operative card game wherein multiple drivers for a delivery company race alongside each other to deliver all parcels correctly to their destinations while avoiding delays like flat tires or aggressive dogs. Contains 12 parcels, 12 homes, 3 dogs, 3 dog treats, 3 flat tires, 3 spare tires, and 4 trucks.

—user summary

Name: The Hungry Ones
Description:
A cooperative tile-placement game in which players seek to arrange the backyard feeders in a pattern that will allow each of the eight different types of creatures to feed without disrupting the others, under the most Family Pastimes-esque tag-line "Let us feed as many hungry creatures as we can, and teach these little ones to share - so no one goes without". Includes rules variants for different age groups.

—user summary

Name: Roll to the Hill: Colina Abajo
Description:
The kids in neighborhood Doragua  and GATO NEGRO compete in who's built the fastest kart.
They've organized wacky kart's races along the highest hills in the city. Who's got the fastest kart?

Roll the dice. Each player chooses from the same dice results and simultaneously draw, with arrows, his kart's movements downhill (six in total). In every movement, or action, the karts go down a level, except for brake and boost.


Español

Los chicos del barrio a y la población b compiten por quien ha construido el carro más rápido.  Han organizado carreras de autos locos a lo largo de las colinas más altas de la ciudad. ¿Quién será el más veloz?

Lanzan los dados y todos los jugadores, con los mismos resultados y simultáneamente, dibujan con flechas los movimientos de su carrito durante el descenso a la colina. Considerando que entre cada acción los carros descienden un nivel –excepto freno e impulso-.

-description from designer

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Treeman
Description:
Treemen in Blood Bowl aren’t so much players as defensive emplacements. In a Wood Elf team, they’re a vital strongpoint, helping to shore up your team’s shortcomings by punching them incredibly hard. For Halflings – whose shortcomings are perhaps too substantial for a whole team of Treemen to overcome – you can throw any underperforming players directly into the End Zone, should the occasion call for it. A multitude of build options for this plastic kit allow you to customise your Treeman (or Treemen!), and it even includes the Blood Bowl debut of a fan-favourite character – Akhorne the Squirrel!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Kickstarter Edition
Description:
Back from the dead and better than ever! Run Fight or Die: Reloaded is a revamped and refreshed edition of the Richard Launius game Run Fight or Die.

In the game, you play a hero trying to survive wave after wave of zombies coming straight for you! You play as a unique character with your own character traits including a minor, major and super combo. You'll need them to fight off the zombies move closer to you every round. You run from location to location, searching for weapons and survivors in a desperate attempt to stay alive. Survivors may bring new skills to help you in your desperate fight for survival, or in some cases, new challenges to overcome. You'll also need them along if you want to win as every survivor provides you victory points.

This streamlined version removes several decks from the original game, including the Fleeing deck and Event deck. Players rolls six dice instead of five and there are now different combos to mitigate against tough zombie-filled rolls. Additionally, players can now use followers to soak damage coming in from zombies.

The game ends either when one player dies, the Town Line comes out of the locations deck, or when the Mutant Zombie has been put down once and for all.  Whoever has the most leadership points among surviving players wins.

Run, Fight, or Die: Reloaded is a frantic first person experience for 1 to 4 players (will play up to 6 with the 5/6 player expansion).

Note: This is an exclusive edition that contains the following promos/exclusives, in addition to the content normally available in the Retail edition. (Source)


     1 Mutant Zombie miniature
         23 Mutant cards (plus 1 promo listed below)
         1 promo Mutant card (Mutant Howl)
    
     1 special edition event die
         1 Event die results card
    
     14 other promo cards
         8 Loot cards (2 each of Barricade, Fireworks, Flashlight, Lawnmower)
         4 Followers (Nervous Thief, Panicked Doctor, Prepared Survivalist, Punk Brawler)
         2 Location cards (Cabin In The Woods, Crystal Lake)
    
     2 exclusive Character boards (Soccer Mom, Wanderer)
     The solo campaign
         Contents as listed here

Name: All or Nothing card game
Description:
A 12-slice pizza has been ordered. Everyone is hungry and wants to eat the entire pizza on their own. The game captures the tussle that follows. The winner of each round gets to eat the whole pizza.

> Party scene


     There is a 12-slice pizza on the table. All the players want the entire pizza to themselves. 
     Each player can add or subtract slices by playing a card. 
     The player to complete 12 slices gets the whole pizza. 


> Type of cards


     Green cards: can be used to add slices.
     Red cards: can be used to subtract slices. By playing a red 


card you remove slices from the pizza.

     Black cards: can be used to add or subtract as you wish, you have to speak out while playing the card. 
     Double-order card: If a player plays the double-order card, it means the players have to complete 24 slices to win the round. 
     On the house card: If a player plays this card, it means they have a special coupon for that round. If they can complete the pizza they will get double points of the number of cards there are in the center. In case another player completes the pizza, this card expires and becomes useless for the player who played it. 


—description from the publisher

Name: Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders & Medic
Description:
Nemesis: Aftermath & Void Seeders & Medic is an expansion for Nemesis. It contains all of the stretch goals from the Kickstarter campaign: the Aftermath expansion, the Void Seeders expansion, and the Medic.
—user summary

"Every spaceship has a voice; a melody of machinery and subsystems its crew learns intimately during long travels. The problem is, ever since the last mission our ship sounds WRONG. There’s something foul in the way it’s speaking to us. Barely audible murmurs. Strange whispers no machine could make. The dark corridors and vast halls almost seem to SING.

Some of us have tried to locate sources of this interferences, but they always seemed two steps ahead. Stalked by their never-ending presence, we soon started cracking. Our engineer has cut some words on his flesh. When we asked why, he replied:‘Incandescent secrets need to be written in blood’. Then, our navigator took a spacewalk without her suit. When we pulled her in, her entire face frozen and cracked, she grinned in a way I will never forget.

Now, it got even worse. Noises turned into voices, sharing tales of slaughter and terror. They do not run from us anymore. They encircle us and herd us through the ship to some dark purpose. I need to UNDERSTAND them before it’s too late. I put my hand on the pistol grip, looking at the backs of my last two crewmembers. I see dark mysteries swirling under their skulls. It would only take two bullet holes to release them..."

Rules:

Overlook:

Voidseeders are a race that can interact with the minds of crew members. They will have few nests instead of one, but only one strong fighting presence at given moment. Once killed, new one will be awakened from the most developed nest.

This race will focus on whispering and controlling minds - people who will be near them will start to hear voices commanding them to do different destructive things.

Nests:

On the board, there is normally 1 Nest as a room token, but there are additionally 2-3 smaller nests. Those are places where new Voidseeders will born. At the moment of discovering main Nest, you should put a Stalker miniature in it (this is the model that is on the ship from the beginning. He is very dangerous, especially when faced by people with a high Insanity level).

Other Nests will start showing up on the board together with discovering certain Exploration tokens. Those nests will be especially dangerous. They will not move, but if a crew member will happen to end the turn at the tile with a nest, he will get a serious wound.

Voidlurkers

They will spawn in nests, and their objective will be to spread insanity and try to move players to Nests.

Whispersers

They will work very similar to Voidlurkers, but with the difference that they will have the main goal of defending the main nest.

Stalker

He is a main guardian. He takes advantage from fear / insanity of the crew members and will focus on them.

Despoiler

Equivalent of the Queen. Actually, it is hard to say if she is real or if it is a mass hallucination. One way or the other, she will only emerge when all Insanity tokens are on players (number of tokens will be specific for different numbers of players). She is extremely strong.

Contamination card

Here it will change a little bit - players will normally get a contamination card every time they will get an insanity token. They will be easier to discard (you don't need to check if it was infected or not). Effect of the card will only take place at the very end of the game, and it will be the same as in the normal version - if it will turn out it was indeed "infected," it will mean that your character, even if escaped, went mad and lost the game either way.

Whispers mechanic

This mechanism will change the noise mechanic. Whenever you move (or an event card will tell you to), you will need to roll for whispers. If you would get a corridor with an whisper token already in it (you hear something more) - you need to draw a Card from the Insanity deck. Those cards will apply to you or not based on the numbers of insanity tokens your character has. Effects might be very different - from one-time action to permanent disabilities.

Combat

In combat, Voidlurkers will only try to add insanity tokens to you and then run away to the closes nest. Whisperers will be harder to kill, as well as present some portion of actual physical danger, but their main weapon will still be giving you insanity tokens.

Things will change with Stalker and Despoiler - those two will be huge opponents who will give you real wounds, so you will not want to be near them.

Event phase

In the event phase, one additional step that will be added is checking your insanity tokens and numbers of Voidlurkers and Whisperers in all rooms next to yours. If the number of them is higher than the number of insanity tokens, you add one insanity token and draw one contamination card.

But whenever you will be in a room with other people, this effect will be less harmful. (they can help you calm down)

Overall feel

Overall feel we will be going for will be way different from what you will have in the base Core Box. We have a lot of cool ideas how to get Insanity cards in a way, that it will be an additional layer of you not trusting your friends  - not only because of their objective but perhaps because of the Insanity cards.

Additionally, interaction with Voidseeders will be way different, you will need to think very carefully where to move or place your hero to not go insane.

—description from the publisher

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Jugador
Description:
Special Promo for Análisis-Parálisis 2020 campaign

Jugador (Player) - Any time you gain 1 Debt, also gain 1 Silver
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Plumbs and Play
Description:
Plumbs is a tube card game ... or rather the tube game!

Create the conduct by joining the various pipes and try to accumulate more points than your opponents, forming lines of the same color. But beware of competition from other players, basically you have the same purpose!

Join the tube cards together by matching the tightening screws, also using tubes of different colors, so as to compose the main line or game line. When assembling continuous sections of 3 or more tube cards of the same color (complete set), remove them and keep them aside !!

At the end of the game, count the points shown on the tubes you have accumulated and ... whoever scores the most points wins! Simple isn't it ?!

Preparation
1. Shuffle the Main Deck of Cards
2. Place the main deck of cards mixed in to the side of the table down (henceforth Deck of Peach), so as to leave free space in the play area in front of you

Deal 3 cards to each player
The older player starts the turn and proceeds clockwise;

Play
1. The turn player starts by drawing 2 cards from the Draw Deck;
2. During his turn the player:
• He can play Pipe cards (if he has them), remembering that:
 The pipe cards played must be attached to the other pipe cards already present in the Game Area through the clamping screws;
 If there are no tube cards in the Game Area, the player can start a new line or conduct by placing a new tube card in the Game Area. (which will cause the first player to start the game);
 If you have tube cards in your hand that cannot be attacked anywhere (the tightening screws do not attach to any of the cards in the Game Area) you can decide to play it and start a new line or conduct;
• Can play Special or Cassette cards (if he has them);
• Cannot discard cards during his turn (except in special cases explained later);
• He can only pass hands if he has 3 or fewer cards in his hand.

Finally, remember one last rule:
All the special type cards or tools used or the tube cards removed will be discarded and placed face up next to the Fishing Deck, thus composing the discard pile.

End of the game
The game ends when there are no more cards to draw in the Draw Deck. After the last player of the turn has drawn the last card from the deck, the final game turn will proceed: after this, the game will end.

The tube cards left in the hand of each player will be counted as a penalty and the points shown above them will be subtracted from the player's final score ... so remember to use them (be careful though, continuing existing lines or starting new ones can provide advantages to the players after you!)

Count points and win
Each player at the end of the game counts the points shown above the accumulated tube cards.

Victory is achieved depending on the game mode chosen:
1. "Kill them all" (about 30 minutes): the player who scores the most points in a single round wins;
2. "Long road to ruin" (about 60 minutes): The first player who reaches 5000 points in one or more game rounds wins. If the player scores the necessary points during a round of play, he will still have to complete the game, hoping not to be exceeded in the point count and therefore not to stick to the ... tube!

-description from publisher

Name: Spirits of the Forest: Moonlight
Description:
Spirits of the Forest: Moonlight is an expansion for the base game that adds a scenario-based co-op mode that can also be played in solitaire, and an alternative multiplayer variant that can be played up to four players.

Nocturnal Creatures - These creatures will be a fundamental part of the game as their position in the Forest will decide which tiles you will get access to during your turn, and which moonlight bits you will be able to keep.

Moonlight bits - These little creatures will primarily allow you to score points at the end of each scenario. The more you get, the more Spirits you will be able to get points from.

Moonlight tiles - This is a new type of tile that will be included in selected scenarios and in the multiplayer variant of Moonlight. Its rules will change depending on the scenario you are playing.

Moonlight cards - Moonlight cards act as missions to accomplish. These cards show four spirits of which you need a majority in order to avoid losing 6 points for each unfulfilled spirit.
Ties won’t be considered as a majority.

-description from publisher

Name: Rights a.k.a. Startups
Description:
The cancelled Spring Game Market 2020, was going to be the 10th Game Market that Oink Games had an exhibit at. So the founder, Mr. Sasaki, was thinking to have a booth by himself, just like the first exhibit, separate from Oink Games and to make and sell games that would be difficult for Oink Games itself to handle. One of those games is Rights a.k.a. Startups.

This game is Startups made by touching up Rights. Made by Mr. Sasaki as a hobby for events, we took "Startups" and gave it the look and feel of "Rights". But since the rules for both "Startups" and "Rights" are included, we think it is a nice package for people that like both games.

No rules changes, there are 2 separate instruction manuals, one for each game. Both utilize the same components with only slight variation between them.

Name: Wyvern: Chameleon
Description:
Changing the Kingdom of Wyvern.
The Chameleon Expansion Set adds 90 common and uncommon cards to the Kingdom, and features colorful and captivating original artwork.
As you dominate your vast empire, you will want to collect all 90 Chameleon cards to strengthen your army of Dragons, enhance your Battlefield position, and increase your Treasure hoard.
Be warned...both your Battlefield and your opponent's Battlefield will be constantly changing with the Chameleon Expansion Set!
NEW RULES: Native Terrain & Chameleon Reaction
Plus rule clarifications.

Name: Bang!
Description:
Each player controls two pawns: a sheriff and a robber.  The sheriff's goal is to earn money by winning duels against robbers and recovering stolen money from robbers or their hideouts.  Robbers must avoid being eliminated (losing 3 duels), as the game ends when all robbers have been eliminated.  When the last robber loses the third duel, the game is over and the sheriff with the most money wins.

Contents: 1 game board, 1 shot indicator, 4 large pawns (sheriffs), 4 small pawns (bandits), 40 $100.00 bills, 40  "Colt 44" cards, 10 bandages, 4 gold bags, 2 dice

Name: Showboat
Description:
A new family card game played with an Island Deck, a six-suited deck of 54 cards.  Because play is simultaneous, it doesn't matter if there is a single dealer, or if the job is shared between players.

Players play six hands, each consisting of several rounds.  On each round, players will play one card and (usually) pick up one card from the center of the table.  The played cards are collected into a tableau, which is a sequence of cards that is worth points at the end of the hand.

The player with the highest score after six hands wins the game.


     Number cards are worth their face value, but only if they are larger than all cards played before them.
     Face cards are worth five points each, and they do not follow the same ordering rules as number cards.  They can be anywhere.
     If your last card follows the ordering rules it scores double, unless you were the last player, in which case it scores normally.
     Cards in your hand are worth negative points, unless they are duplicated in your hand, in which case they are worth zero.


The best you can typically score is 35 points, with three 5-point cards, one 6, and a doubled 7, as well as a zero point hand.  This is called a Showboat.

Name: High Seas: The Collision Regulations Game
Description:
A board game published in limited numbers by the Canadian Navy for its personnel to play aboard long boring voyages at sea, and improve their innate knowledge of collisions-avoidance. Since it's a government asset intended for use at sea, it's made of fantastically high-quality materials which help to make up for how utterly inane the actual trivia proves to be (example: According to the 1972 mandate, what is the minimum length of sounding cord that should be trailed behind any vessel approaching a port from the leeward side with the intention to transfer cargo after dusk?"). The game box also includes a copy of the hefty "Collision Regulations: International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea, 1972 - with Canadian modifications, 1983".

Players start out taking only yellow coastal routes, but as their knowledge progresses their ships (oddly represented as multicoloured faux bullets made of iron termed "projies") can move out into the ocean, ultimately needing to reach certain key ports and complete specific routes, all while avoiding hazards and inclement weather. The winner is officially termed the "Commander of the High Seas", and more importantly the Canadian naval personnel have passed another two hours at sea. The popularization of video games ultimately rendered traditional classics like "High Seas" less necessary.

It was reported that the initial printing was of only 100 copies of the game in October 1987 for initial deployment and testing, and it's unclear whether there were later versions produced as the rules stated "Copyright 1988"; it is referred to in naval literature as both "High Seas: A Collision/s Regulation Game" and "High Seas: A Performance Maintenance Game".

—user summary

Name: Brilliant Or BS? Trivia Party Game
Description:
Brilliant Or BS? is a 4-6 player party game for know-it-alls and big fat liars! Players read multiple choice trivia questions and earn points by predicting which of the other players guessed correctly before answers are revealed. Can you tell when your friends are BSing? Play this hilarious party game and find out.

There are six different categories of trivia including Sports, Entertainment, Food & Drink, Science & Technology, Geography and History.

Players take turns being the Judge by reading one yellow question card and the three multiple choice answers.

The other players have 10 seconds to respond by placing one of their A-B-C answer cards face down.

Starting with the player to the Judge’s left and going clockwise, each player tries to convince the Judge that they got the question right without saying the answer. They must come up with a convincing explanation as to how or why they know the correct answer...even if they don’t.

After everyone pleads their case, the Judge grabs the two black cards and gives the Brilliant card to the person they think got the question right and the BS card to the person they think got it wrong.

The player that receives the Brilliant card automatically earns 2 points and the player who receives the BS card earns 0 points.

The Judge announces the correct answer (highlighted in bold) before asking the other players to reveal their cards. The players who did NOT receive a Brilliant or BS card go first, followed by the player who received the BS card. The person who received the Brilliant card reveals their answer last. Each player that gets the question right earns 1 point.

The Judge receives 1 point for each correct Brilliant prediction and 1 point for each correct BS prediction. But beware. For each wrong prediction, the Judge loses 1 point.

Play continues until each person has had the chance to be the Judge the same number of times. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins. (Suggested length of game play is 1 hour.)

Name: Dek Divers
Description:
You are an elite Dek Diver - a hacker procing illegal ice breaking warez on your black market cyberspace dek to raid megacorp datavaults! Can you make it away with the highest value infotrove before syndicate enforcers and corp goons catch up with you?

Each turn you will Dive into cyberspace by rolling two dice - hoping to exploit the fickle cybernetic currents. You will choose either the die’s individual values, or their sum and use them to execute processes (Proc) on your Dek.

You may stop your Dive after any roll. Or you may continue Diving, rolling the dice in order to Proc more Carts, as long as you have CPU cycles to handle the outcomes. If your CPU can’t handle it, your Dive is aborted and you lose your progress for that turn. Be careful though, other players can piggyback and leech off of your Dive and Proc some of their Carts during your turn as well!

The game ends when there is only one datavault card left unclaimed, and players total the victory points on their cards. Have you made enough credits to score those chrome and neon implants, or is it time to skip town and start a new life on the off-world colonies?

-description from designer

Name: The King's Tournament: Card Game
Description:
The King has proclaimed a contest shall be held to establish a new Champion. As a local noble, sponsoring the winning champion would earn you considerable royal notoriety. In this strategic card game, players use their noble influence to guide their sponsored characters in currying regal favor, initiating duels with their opponents, and conspiring against their rivals to determine the winner of The King's Tournament!

To win the game you must earn the favor of the King by advancing one of your Characters from the starting White Level of Distinction through the Red Level up to the Blue Level. Once one of your characters reaches the Blue Level of Distinction, you have won the game!

On your turn you may curry favor with the King by playing a Favor Point card. These cards each contain a numerical value. and have different titles representing the various aspects of life in the Royal Court, but all essentially have the same effect - gaining Favor with the King.

In addition to showing off their manners in Court, the most aggressive way for your sponsored heroes to earn the King’s attention is to challenge their fellow competitors to duels of honor. There are three basic Duel cards: Attack, Defend, and Counterattack. Additionally, there are Enhancer cards such as Weapons and Spells that will increase the strength of a Character's attack or defense in a Duel.

As the Royal Court acts as the heart of the political system in Fleissen, it is a site of intense competition. Nobles vie to attract the King’s notice, but also use the Court to attack the reputation of their opponents. Intrigue cards represent ways a Character can be effected by rumor, innuendo, and sabotage by such cards as Poison, Intimidation, and Humiliation.

Navigating your sponsored heroes through the Royal Courts and coaching them through rounds of duels to win the King's favor will earn them the rank of the King's Champion - and earn you considerable influence and renown within the Four Kingdoms!

—description from the designer

Name: Cigar Game
Description:
In Cigar Game, players take the role of cigar manufacturers. Acquiring leaves and production methods from regions all over the world, players will attempt to create some of the most unique and desirable cigars in the hopes of gaining the title of the Most Prestigious Cigar Maker.

Cigar Game uses drafting mechanics which players will use to gain tobacco leaves, as well as a variety of methods in which to grow, ferment, and age them.

Each cigar is formed by combining three leaves together to form the wrapper, binder, and filler. Prestige points are gained based on the leaves used for the cigar, how long it was aged, and any added modifiers. Additional objectives can be met through rolling and selling cigars to gain extra Prestige points. The player with the most Prestige at the end wins!

Enjoy Cigar Game with friends at home or the local cigar lounge over a nice drink and your favorite stick. Being easy to learn and quick fun will make Cigar Game a group favorite for years to come and a great gift for the cigar aficionados in your life.

Name: Gardens of Babylon: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Gardens of Babylon: Deluxe Edition comes with content not found in the retail edition - 48 upgraded custom meeples, 144 upgraded custom seed tokens, 1 collectible coin, and The Assyrain expansion (1 black saboteur meeple, 1 black six sided die, and 36 poison tokens).

Adding a new element to the game, the Assyrian is an agent from a rival empire to the North. Seeking to undermine the glorious jewel of Babylon, he works against all guilds to weaken the wonder of the ancient world. At the end of each turn, a player may have the chance to move this lone agent. Travelling around the Garden the Assyrian may be used to poison ponds - destroying seeds currently planted there and rendering the ponds unplantable for the rest of the game!

The Assyrian can also be added to the solo mode with just a few extra rules.

Name: Inept Recruits
Description:
Inept Recruits is a card drafting, set collection game. You win by completing formations using recruits from the recruit line. Each formation is worth 3-6 points, complete 15 points worth of formations to trigger game end, have the most points at the end to win! In addition to using recruits to complete formations, each recruit has its own special ability that can be used to get the recruits you need out of the recruit line.

-description from publisher

Name: UNO: Speed Racer
Description:
The usual Uno rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Race X Card - This card is a booby trap you can play on your rivals. But be warned, you could get caught in your own trap! When you play this card, you immediately flip the top card from the draw pile onto the discard pile (this card needs to be a number card, so, if necessary keep flipping over cards until a number card is on top.

Going in the current direction, each player in turn must play a card from their hand that is ONE number higher than the card on top of the discard pile. You would play a 0 after a 9.

Continue to go around until a player can not do this and they will draw 3 cards.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Animal Your Name
Description:
Guessing the face-up cards are “whose” favorite food is? 
And “whose” favorite game is? The player who knows and says the names of animals most will be winner of this game!

—description from the designer

Name: Ice Tumble
Description:
Players take turns rolling the die and taking ice blocks from the center of the game area based on the die roll (1 block, 2 blocks, take 1 from an opponent, etc). When you remove a block from the center, you may only use one hand and can not have any other piece move aside from the one you are taking. If that happens, you must take another block as a penalty. Continue to go clock wise rolling the die and collecting ice blocks until they are all gone. Then phase two begins.

Players roll the die and resolve which will result in placing 1 ice block, 2 ice blocks, or giving an ice block to an opponent. 
If any part of the tower falls, all pieces go into the game box and that player must take 2 of them and add them to their supply.

Play continues like this until one player to successfully places their last ice block(s) and their fox pawn on the sculpture.

Game Includes:
    24 Ice Blocks
    4 Fox Pawns
    2 Sculpture Platforms
    1 Die
    1 Game Mat
    1 Storage Bag
    1 Rules Booklet

Name: Tsuro of the Seas: Phoenix Action Tile
Description:
Contains stretch goals from Tsuro: Phoenix Rising KS campaign:

     "Phoenix" wake tile for Tsuro of the Seas
     Alternate Phoenix/Dragon tile for use in either Tsuro or Tsuro: Phoenix Rising
     8 rainbow pawns for Tsuro
     8 rainbow ships for Tsuro: Phoenix Rising

Name: Puerto Miau: Roll and Steal
Description:
Puerto Miau: Roll and Steal is a roll and write game where you will have to compete to be the cat that manages to steal as many fish from the fishmonger, become the cat that manages to steal more fish.

Roll the dice and start moving your tile around the board, you will have to choose carefully where you fall to achieve a good score since you will not be able to return to that place since you will not be the only cat moving around the board if you play accompanied, to steal. You will have to resort to your luck only then you can successfully steal each fish.

—description from the designer

Name: Booksmart
Description:
Booksmart is a game for fans of classic literature... or just the prankster in your friend group who can convince anyone of anything.

The dealer takes a card and reads out the title and author of a classic novel. Players write down what they think (or want others to think) the first sentence of that novel is.

After all answers are handed in, the dealers reads them out, slipping in the real sentence along the way. Players must vote on which answer they think is correct.

The person who guesses the correct sentence gets two points, but if you manage to trick everyone into thinking your answer is the real one, you get a point too. Player with the most points at the end wins!

Booksmart can be played with family, friends or used as an educational tool in the classroom.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Heroes I
Description: Both the Dothraki Horse Lords and the famous Unsullied owe their allegiance to the Mother of Dragons, Daenerys Targaryen. Their officers and veterans lead her troops to victory over time and again across the world with a combination of skill, charisma, and iron discipline. While leaders of these disparate groups posses vastly different styles of command, the results are much the same. Their troops fight harder, move faster, and survive long enough to see the next battle. Above all, their dedication to the Dragon Queen is absolute, and their faith in her cause is unshakable.
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Heroes I
Description:
When Robert Baratheon died, control of the Iron Throne went to his son Joffrey. However, Robert’s brothers are also seeking to claim the throne for themselves. Both Stannis and Renly want it, each one with a cadre of followers who support their claim to the Iron Throne and are willing to do what they can to seat their choice seated there.

The Baratheon Heroes #1 box set gives House Baratheon players in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game a host of options for when they field an army loyal to King Stannis. The box set contains seven new characters, including a new version of King Stannis himself. With four new options for army’s Commander, players will be able to customize their forces to their liking. All the Stat and Tactics cards needed to play these devoted followers are included, so they can be used right out of the box.
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Heroes II
Description:
Though Renly might be the younger of the Baratheon brothers looking to lay claim to the Iron Throne, it doesn’t mean he has any less conviction to go and take it. He has collected his forces and headed to the field of battle, even if it means diving House Baratheon between those loyal to him and those loyal to King Stannis.

The Baratheon Heroes #2 box set for the Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon players eager to see Lord Renly on the Iron Throne a bunch of new options for their forces. With new Attachments, NCUs, and new choices for their army Commander, the set is a great way for players to customize their forces to fit their own particular playstyle.
Families: Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Gloriel Summerbloom – Star Player
Description:
Gloriel Summerbloom is famously whimsical and carefree, even for a Wood Elf! She revels in the beauty and grace of a well-played game, though she doesn't care for the violence which everyone else seems to enjoy so much. Her fans find this refreshing, whilst her detractors find it hopelessly naive. What none dispute, however, is her almost supernatural throwing accuracy and agility on the pitch.

Your Wood Elf team can hire this Star Player to ensure a stunning passing game. Not only is the model incredible, encapsulating the grace and fluidity of Wood Elfs, but her Skill list is amazing. She’s posed mid-leap, holding the ball back in a wind-up to a throw, her long braid and sash flowing around her. If you're looking for a fun painting project, the detailed leaves, vines, and hair will make for a suitably impressive display piece!

This finely detailed resin model is supplied in 9 components, including a 32mm round base. Gloriel Summerbloom is exclusively available to play for Wood Elf teams. You can find all the rules you need to use her in your games of Blood Bowl in the 7th issue of Spike! Journal, the Team Card Pack: Wood Elf Team and the Blood Bowl Almanac 2019.

Key Features
- Give the already-impressive Wood Elf passing game a boost with this unique Thrower.
- Her dynamic pose captures the beauty and grace of the Wood Elf team.
- Highly detailed leaves, vines, sashes and flowing hair make for a fun painting challenge.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: SEC Game Day
Description:
Have you ever wanted to coach a football team in the highly competitive Southeastern Conference (SEC) of college football? With SEC Game Day, you can do just that.

Pick your team- all 14 SEC teams are available- and place its respective magnet in one end zone. Next, draw your hand of cards from one of two specialized card decks (offense and defense) to simulate play calling.

One player will be on offense and the other on defense, and each player selects a play call from their hand of cards. Playing the cards simultaneously, a comparison is done using a chart on each card, with the magnetic football being moved on the board accordingly.

For example, it's 1st and 10 at the offensive player's 40 yard line. The offensive player chooses an option play, while the defensive player selects a pass defense. The chart on the card indicates that the play results in a 10-yard gain. The football is moved forward to the 50 yard line and both players get ready to pick their next play.

Name: Tour de Bar
Description:
Your are set in the Czech city of Brno alongside with your friends trying to achieve the best night out in the city's well-known bars. As you walk through the historical center you sip various drinks and try not to pass out. Both bar visits and random surprises on the game plan affect your point score.

When playing Tour de Bar, you roll the dice and move your stick around the board to visit bars and consume drinks and food there. You get satisfaction points ("spokopoints") for consumption, and whoever has the most of these chips at the end wins because they had the best evening. To make it not so simple, several types of cards affect the action in the game. For example, each round is different thanks to the cards from the DÄ›ní v Brno pack. Sometimes the train station is moved, other times there is a Moto GP, a party at the beginning of the semester or a Zombie Walk. Only the Nuda card in Brno keeps everything normal.

In combination with cards of chance, cards that affect bonuses when visiting different bars, something is always happening in the game and the hunt for imaginary drinks has an impact. In addition, you still have to think about the fact that you lose sobriety points by drinking alcohol, and as soon as your number drops to zero, you willy-nilly go home to bed for two rounds.

Game plan contains various events, public tramway system, theme of the game round, bar attributes and finally - your game character which gives you a unique possibilities. As in real life your are motivated to explore and experience the whole setting of the game. Who has the most point from drinks and food consummation after all the game rounds passes by - wins!

Note: this is not a drinking game - just a game about drinking.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Spellslinger Starter Kit
Description: Two starter decks: One White and One Red.

Name: Operation Dauntless: C3i #30 scenarios
Description:
Two scenarios and a Normandy Battle generator for Operation Dauntless included in C3i #30. These scenarios were left out for lack of time and space for counters in the original game.

Scenarios:
18.17 "The End of the 6th Dukes" Stopping the Juvigny-Fontenay Gap (June 27th, a.m.)
18.18 "The Gauntlet: (Fictitious)
Normandy Battle Generator

Includes Rules, optional rules, setup notes, strategic and historical notes. Also includes 1 double sided setup and tables card and 51 double sided die cut counters.

Name: Shadows of Kilforth: New Tales Expansion Pack
Description:
Shadows of Kilforth: New Tales includes 36 brand new, unique, and gorgeously illustrated cards to add to your games of Shadows of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game! New ancients, new ancient abilities, new encounters, new races, new classes, and new rewards add a wealth of variety to your game and versatility to your hero builds—simply shuffle the extra cards into your game and you are ready to go.

New Tales includes all of the extra cards we weren't able to squeeze into the Kickstarter: awesome new races, classes, sagas, encounters, and rewards to beef up and enrich your experience of Shadows of Kilforth!

Did I even mention that New Tales also comes with eight gorgeous standees?? We've had to make the box even bigger than the pictured box just to fit them all in!

— From the publisher

Name: Too Many Bones: The Break Keeper and Undertow Campaign+ Card Pack
Description: The Campaign+ Pack includes three unique Campaign cards for Too Many Bones: Undertow. The cards included are "Junkette's Junction, Addressing the Mohlnor, and Your Prototypical Soul Preserver." These cards are also available as a part of the Too Many Bones: Undertow riddle rewards.

Name: Too Many Bones: Attack Dice BGG Promo Pack
Description: This pack includes three attack dice with slightly adjusted odds for Too Many Bones and Too Many Bones: Undertow. These attack dice double both your odds of landing a critical hit as well as rolling a miss (bone). This pack is exclusive to BGG. Two of these dice are also available as a part of the Stanza character Add-on in Game to Pick a Game.

Name: Goal!
Description:
Goal! is a Dutch football game that is played by two players. Each player has a goalkeeper and ten field players. The game board consists of square boxes.
In one turn, a player rolls two dice: a die with special actions such as passing or dribbling and a regular die to determine how many squares the actions can be performed. The ball can be placed on a player's foot so that possession is clear.
The goal is simple: score more goals than your opponent within the agreed time.

—user summary

Name: Hard City: Heroes of Hard City
Description:
This expansion will allow you to play as five new heroes: William Casey, Aaron Kaufmann, Regan O’Hara, Garett Oliver and the H.A.R.DMan!

Set includes:
5x officers miniatures,
30x skill cards,
5x officer sheets.

Name: Score
Description:
Score is a Dutch football game played by two players.
Each player has 11 cards: 8 with the value 1, 2 with the value 2 and 1 with the value 3. Each player makes his line-up by placing the cards on the squares on the board.
Each turn the players may take turns to perform an action: two players change positions (keeping the player in possession of the ball) or play the ball to another player. All actions are done via the black lines on the game board. If the player is in one of tehe 5 forward positions with the ball and he has a higher value than his direct opponent, he will score a goal. If there is no goal scored within five actions, the possession will change to the other player.
The winner is the player who has scored the most goals after an agreed time.

—user summary

Name: Munchkinomicon
Description: The Chinese (å°ç™½ä¸–ç´€ ç©¶æ¥µé­”æ³•æ›¸), French, and Spanish (Munchkinomicón) editions of Munchkinomicon also include the Munchkin Reloaded!, Munchkin: Marked For Death, and Munchkin Monster Enhancers cards.

Name: That's So Gay!
Description:
The phrase “That’s so gay!” has been used mostly in a negative context for decades. Some people use it as a way to attack or vilify us, and others use it in fun, not realizing the damage it can do. As with the reclaiming of negative words and phrases such as “queer,” this game seeks to turn “That’s so gay!” into a positive opportunity to educate LGBTQs and our allies, and even those people who would attack us. Words can be a tool of our enemies, or can empower us in our work. And this game hopes to break down stereotypes while having some fun with our LGBTQ history. There are the well-known celebrities and media sensations, but also obscure authors, scientists, athletes and pioneers. The scope of the game goes back thousands of years and across multiple continents, all with more than 2,400 questions that will tease you, taunt you, and treat you to some amazing facts. This game would be the most enjoyable for adults and for children ages 12 and up. It is best played in teams, but even two players can have fun testing their knowledge. There are all ranges of questions, so even those who think they “know it all” about the LGBTQ community will undoubtedly sometimes find themselves stumped. This game was created and produced by Tracy Baim, co-founder and publisher of Windy City Times, an LGBTQ newspaper founded in 1985. She has been volunteering and working in the LGBTQ community since 1984.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wir bauen ein Haus
Description:
Roll and run game. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 120 wins the game. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the player. The players may gain and loose tokens while playing. The player with the most tokens at the end of the game is the starting player for the next game.

This promotional game is from the 1950s.

—user summary

Name: Space Plague
Description:
Space Plague is a modern strategy game of planetary conquest for 1-4 players.  The four major galactic powers -The Slimes, The Reptilians, The Rams, and The Flat-Earthers - all want one thing, galactic dominance.  Their commanders ready themselves, the armies follow orders, and everything that can shake, shakes.  The race to conquer new planets is the most important game in the galaxy and those that win it will gain for themselves and their species a brand new spherical land mass to rule and to populate.

In Space Plague, players will employ hand management and hand building strategies to efficiently guide their plague soldiers through various ecological environments while collecting energy (the game’s currency), adapting to planetary events, and overcoming the opponents’ obstacles that await them on their unwavering march toward the planet’s core.  Survival of the fittest is the name of the game as the faction with the greatest number of soldiers to reach the core will be crowned the victor and given the deed to the planet.

The keys to victory are careful planning and adaptability. Everyone will begin the game with the same starting hand of action cards.  These will be used each round to spawn, move, shield, or evolve your aliens. Additionally, certain factors will give variability to each game.   Each planet you conquer has its own defense mechanisms which will force you to employ unique strategies and play styles.  Planetary events are randomized and could spell riches or doom for your advancing soldiers.  Additionally, the in-game marketplace offers dozens of evolutions that will improve the capabilities of your hand or grant you unique ongoing or temporary powers ensuring a different game every time.  These elements not only force interesting decisions but also give the game extensive replayability.

Fellow commander, are you ready to join the plague?

—description from the designer

Space Plague es un moderno juego de estrategia de conquista planetaria de 1-4 jugadores. Los cuatro poderes galácticos principales, los Resbaladizos, los Reptoides, las cabras y los Terraplanistas, todos quieren una cosa, el dominio galáctico. Sus comandantes se preparan, los ejércitos siguen órdenes y todo lo que puede temblar, tiembla. La carrera para conquistar nuevos planetas es el juego más importante de la galaxia y aquellos que lo ganen obtendrán para ellos y su especie una nueva masa de tierra esférica para gobernar y poblar.

En Space Plague, los jugadores emplearán estrategias de manejo y construcción de manos para guiar de manera eficiente a sus creaturas de la plaga a través de varios entornos ambientales mientras recolectan energía (la moneda del juego), se adaptan a los eventos planetarios y superan los obstáculos de los oponentes que los esperan en su marcha hacia el núcleo del planeta. La supervivencia del más apto es el nombre del juego, ya que la facción con el mayor número de creaturas para llegar al núcleo será coronado como vencedor y se le otorgará el dominio planetario.

Las claves de la victoria son la planificación cuidadosa y la adaptabilidad. Todos comenzarán el juego con la misma mano inicial de cartas de acción. Estos se usarán en cada ronda para generar, mover, proteger o evolucionar a tus criaturas alienígenas. Además, ciertos factores darán variabilidad a cada juego. Cada planeta que conquiste tiene sus propios mecanismos de defensa que te obligarán a emplear estrategias y estilos de juego únicos. Los eventos planetarios son aleatorios y podrían significar riquezas o perdición para los soldados que avanzan. Además, el mercado del juego ofrece decenas de evoluciones que mejorarán las capacidades de tu mano o te otorgarán poderes únicos continuos o temporales que garantizan un juego diferente cada vez. Estos elementos no solo obligan a tomar decisiones interesantes, sino que también le dan al juego una amplia rejugabilidad.

Pequeño comandante, ¿está listo para unirse a la plaga?

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Grimdark Future: Starter Set – Battle for Magellan-2
Description:
Grimdark Future is a miniature wargame set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi battles for new and experienced players alike.
