This starter set gives you everything you need to start playing exciting battles right away, without having to worry about painting miniatures or putting together your own army lists. With game rules that fit on a single page, you'll be able to learn them quickly and start playing in no time!

Simply print out all pages and assemble the armies as described, and you’ll have two balanced forces ready to clash on the field of battle.

Additionally are also provided a set of terrain pieces to spice up your games, as well as a set of play tokens to help you track different game effects.

The Battle for Magellan-2 Starter Set contains all of the following contents:

     Core Game Rules
     Unit Stat Cards (12 Cards)
     Battle Brothers Army (16 Miniatures)
         Heroes: Captain
         Troops: Assault Brothers, Tactical Brothers
         Upgrades: Flamethrower, Missile Launcher
    
     Orc Marauders Army (27 Miniatures)
         Heroes: Warlord, Shaman
         Troops: Orc Mobs, Boss Mobs
         Upgrades: Heavy Machinegun, Rocket Launcher
    
     Terrain Pack (11 Terrain Pieces)
         Small: Fields, Crates & Barrels, Barricades
         Large: Forests, Ruins
    
     Play Tokens (106 Tokens)
         Objectives, Activations, Wounds, Pinning
         Magic, Suppression, Fatigue, Danger
    


—description from the publisher

Name: Ars Bellum
Description:
Relive the great battles of Antiquity and at the head of your army, impose your power on your opponent!

ARS BELLUM is a game of medium complexity, allowing you to simulate all the battles of antiquity. The mechanics are concentrated on 5 pages of rules, for a 16-page booklet with illustrations and scenarios. The whole is easily learned. This system can be a game of discovery of wargames, but also a system that will satisfy the most seasoned players.

This game seeks to have the best compromise between historicity (orders of battle, aspect of the units) and playability.

Players play out the battles of the proposed scenarios, which are descirbed on A4 or A3 maps. Their style is simple and clean. The duration of a game is 1 to 2 hours.

The units (leaders or combat units) have a movement and combat capability (possibly including firepower) and represent 500 to 1000 or 2000 men depending on the type of unit and the scenario. For some scenarios, these figures are theoretical given the sources (difficult to represent the million men of Darius or Xerxes or others).

The system is based on the initiative won by players as a result of a die roll and the impact of leaders and/or other modifiers in the scenario.

In ARS BELLUM, the system is based on the skills of the units, which balance reality and gameplay. These are abilities assigned to units, basic or special, that represent a property or advantage during combat.

The basic module of the game gives the essential rules and discovery scenarios; the extensions are groupings of scenarios around one or more armies, a historical character, a military campaign.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Revivez les grandes batailles de l'Antiquité et à la tête de votre armée, imposez votre puissance à votre adversaire !

ARS BELLUM est un jeu de complexité moyenne, permettant de simuler toutes les batailles de l’Antiquité. Les mécanismes sont concentrés sur 5 pages de règles, pour un livret comportant 16 pages avec les illustrations et les scénarios. L’ensemble est aisément assimilable. Ce système peut être un jeu de découverte des wargames, mais aussi un système qui satisfera les joueurs les plus aguerris.

Ce jeu cherche à avoir le meilleur compromis entre historicité (ordres de bataille, aspect des unités) et jouabilité.

Les joueurs livrent les batailles des scénarios proposés sur des cartes A4 ou A3 maximum. Leur style est simple, propre. La durée d’une partie est d’1 à 2h.

Les unités (chefs ou de combat) ont une capacité de mouvement  et de combat (regroupant éventuellement celle de tir) et représentent 500 à 1000 ou 2000 hommes suivant le type d’unités et le scénario. Pour certains scénarios, ces chiffres sont théoriques compte tenu des sources (difficiles de représenter le million d’hommes de Darius ou Xerxès ou autres).

Le système est basé sur l’initiative conquise par les joueurs suite à un jet de dé et à l’impact des chefs et/ou autre modificateur dans le scénario.

Dans ARS BELLUM, le système s’appuie sur les compétences des unités qui amènent respect de la réalité et particularité ludique. Ce sont des capacités attribuées aux unités, de base ou particulières et qui représentent une propriété ou un avantage durant le combat.

Le module de base du jeu donne l’essentiel des règles et les scénarios de découverte ; les extensions sont des regroupements de scénarios autour d’une ou plusieurs armées, d’un personnage historique, d’une campagne militaire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Qua
Description:
Qua is a three-dimensional (3D) abstract strategy game for three players. It is an extension of the two-dimensional, two player game called Gale, marketed as Bridg-It. Qua is played on a 3D game board grid composed of NxNxN cells in the shape of a cube, where N is typically odd and equal to the number of cells along each edge of the game board.

The objective of Qua is to be the first player to complete a connected chain (path) of cells containing their game play pieces between their two opposite faces of the game board cube.

The 3D game board does not start out empty. Some of the cells in the game board are permanently filled-in with one of three game play pieces, called qua. See Figure 1 from the Images gallery above: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/5539928/qua. The three qua game play pieces--one for each player--are distinguished from each other by shape and color.

Rules
Players choose their qua at the beginning of the game and decide who will go first, second and third in sequential turn order. Each turn, players place one of their qua in an empty cell in the game board cube.

Players may only place qua in an empty cell if it is adjacent to two cells that already contain their qua, or one such cell and one of their two game board cube faces.

If a player cannot make a move, they skip their turn.

If the current player is in a Kingmaker situation where one of the other players will win on their next turn and the one who wins will be determined by the current player's move, then the Qua Kingmaker game play rule states that the current player blocks the immediate next player's win first. However, if no one identifies the Kingmaker situation, and the current player makes a different move, then that move is valid.

The game ends when the first player connects their two faces of the Qua Cube game board.

Game Play Variants
Qua Misere
The first player that connects their two faces of the game board loses. This can be a two-player game.

Dice Qua
Players roll a 6-sided die to determine which game play piece to play on their turn (two sides of the die for each game play piece). This can also be played as a two-person game. A player may win as a result of an opponent’s move.

Name: Unlikely Heroes: Vikings
Description:
Unlikely Heroes: Vikings is a puzzling narrative adventure game in which the unlikely heroes must venture into the dreaded lands of pillaging and plunder with three unique quests to ensure your legacy: The Ruins, The Mead, and The Living Dead.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map. As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

Box contents
50+ page Adventure book
200+ Gamecards
20 x Acrylic cubes
4 x Meeples
Rulebook

Name: Unlikely Heroes: Cowboys
Description:
Unlikely Heroes: Cowboys is a puzzling narrative adventure game in which the four friends are faced with three bullet-proof challenges, roaming the vast desert with outlaws around every dune: The Convict, The Train Job, and The Gold Hunt.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map. As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

Name: Quin
Description:
Quin is an abstract tabletop strategy game, taking place in a sci-fi quantum realm.  Players control a variety of quark particles, 17 on each side, made of 9 types, each with distinct speed, powers and capture abilities.  The goal of Quin is to reach First Sight, Center, with your Light, or to capture your opponent's Light.

Your pieces are always faced away from your rival, making deception and memory two of the most important skills in play. Use a piece's special abilities - like Memory that swaps places with another piece, Time that can move an opposing piece backward, Peripherals that can circle the sides of the board, or Shadows that reach far and capture everything - and you risk revealing your strategy.  In Quin, your choices, and how well you know your rival, are what determine your fate.

The magnetic Quin board is based on a traditional grid, if you can imagine that grid warped into a circle by a black hole.  As such it is made of 5 Sight Lines, crossing the board at the center, 8 gold Rings, a Horizon Line, and the Iris.  The Iris is just 2 spaces around the center, where most pieces have to pass if they want to get to the other side, and it is a neutral zone, where powers don't work.  In the middle of it all is First Sight, Center, and the goal of the game.

It's only 5 moves to center, from the start, but you'll never take the same route twice.  Awaken your Memory, look out for the thief of Time, and beware the Shadows - they're far faster than Light.

-description from publisher

Name: Chakra: Yin Yang
Description:
The 4 distinct modules of Yin-Yang can be combined at will for a brand-new gameplay experience of Chakra.

The first module introduces new strategic opportunities with the white crystals. They allow you to increase the speed and flow of energies by temporarily harmonizing Chakras. By combining them with negative energies, you will gain Yin-Yang tokens, an additional source of plenitude.

The second module and its harmonization bonuses will speed up the game and make every Chakra attractive, while the third module will have you race to achieve your objectives, forcing you to make difficult choices and increasing interaction.

The last module will then require good timing to benefit the most from the available special abilities.

-description from publisher

Name: Tag!
Description:
Tag! is a dice-driven single card duel game. Each fighter has three attributes (represented by color-coded d6 rolls) and a special ability that affects one or more of your dice or the opponent's dice. Rerolls, special abilities, the order in which you use the dice and the limited way the colors interact with each other makes it far more tactical than simply "high roll wins". A normal match is "best of 3 games". Skirmish rules for up to four fighters on a side are also included and are also a key part of the Tag! Dungeon expansion set.

Tag! was originally designed for convention pickup games or LARPs, where you would wear your fighter like a convention tag (tarot card size) to show willingness to play, but with covid-19 shutting down conventions, it is now just a fast casual game that is also easy to play over any sort of video link.

—description from the publisher

Name: Grazing Sheep
Description:
Keeping sheep well fed and happy is not as easy as you’d think. And these particular sheep are not the brightest of the flock as they need to be shown where the next area of fresh grass is.

If they don’t eat they soon get angry, and you don’t want to be faced with raging sheep. And their eating habits are erratic to say the least. Sometimes they’ll graze a whole quarter of the field, other times they just fancy a nibble.

You do have a sheepdog, Ollie, but he’s pretty lazy and will only help calm the sheep down if there’s a doggie treat in it for him. Now, is that the sound of irate bleating in the air?....

GAMEPLAY
A number of sheep (and four leaf clover) are randomly placed in a field. Your task is to help the sheep eat as much grass as they can. Each area of grazing is determined by the dice you roll. Completely grazed fields score more points.

There is a certain amount of push your luck - do you risk losing one of your limited supply of treats (lives) by going for that final grazing area to complete a field or move on to the next field and lose points for ungrazed areas? Lucky clover can help increase your chances of success.

—description from the designer

Name: Cosmic Colonies: Monumental Achievement Expansion
Description:
This mini-expansion contains 9 monumental tiles, 5 new basic workers and 5 new advanced workers. It's the original extra content that was created during the KS-campaign (and given for free to KS-backers) and will be available afterwards.

You add as much monuments as there are players at the start of the game. If you can create the exact shape of a monument with free squares on your board, you can claim the corresponding monument tile, which will be worth 5 VP at the end of the game.

Name: Adventure Island: How it all began
Description:
Tutorial in German
These cards tell how you stranded on this island.
Trough small adventures you learn the important rules.
The main game is needed.

Tutorial auf Deutsch
Diese Karten erzählen wie Ihr auf der Insel gestrandet seid.
Durch diese kleinen Abentuern werden wichtige Regeln gelernt.
Das Hauptspiel wird beötigt.

Name: Hack
Description:
Friday night. The year is 1999. Teenagers around the country are gathering around in basements and living rooms, bringing with them their monitors, computers, keyboards and network cables. The party is starting.

But this is no ordinary LAN. These kids aren’t here to snipe each other with the Golden Gun, or blast each other with Siege Tanks. They’re not going to watch Anime or bootleg MP3s. They’re here to prove which team has the best hacking skills. The winner gets bragging rights for a week. The loser gets a blue screen of death. So switch on the power strip. Fire up the router. Queue the techno. And get ready to Hack.

Name: Rurik: Stone & Blade
Description:
The throne of Kievan Rus is finally within your grasp — if you can rise above your sibling rivals! Build epic structures, capture your enemies for ransom, and deal with rebel opposition. Will you seize your destiny or fade into obscurity?

Rurik: Stone & Blade is a modular expansion for Rurik: Dawn of Kiev and is divided into core content and three modules. It is recommended to integrate the core content into all future plays of Rurik. You can add an individual module or any combination of modules.

Core Content: More gameplay variety with minimal rules overhead.

Module A – Epic Structures: Build structures to cement your legacy.

Module B – Warfare: Capture opposing troops and hold them for ransom.

Module C – Rebel Factions: Suppress the growing rebel opposition.

Requires Rurik: Dawn of Kiev to play.

-description from publisher

Name: Road Patriots
Description:
Welcome to the Alternate American Revolution!

Road Patriots is a skirmish-style wargame set in an alternate version of 1776 Colonial America. 
In this version of the colonies, the revolution is about to be in full swing. Colonists are preparing to fight the British and claim America as their own country.

However, there is one subtle difference. Both sides of the war have cars--cars that run on steam engines. These cars were used extensively in battles. They often had mounted cannons and muskets. Riders were militia and continentals wielding sabers.

Welcome to the world of vehicular combat during the American Revolution.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Matter of Honor: The Battle of Le Bourget
Description:
A MATTER OF HONOR The Battle of Le Bourget - Oct 30, 1870
 Long before it became the site of Charles Lindbergh's landing after his first air crossing of the Atlantic Ocean and later of a renowned international Airshow, the town of Le Bourget, in the outskirts of Paris, was the scene of a bloody battle between the French Army and the Prussian forces besieging Paris in October 1870, during the Franco-Prussian War.
 A Matter of Honor is an action-packed two-player tactical board game using a simple but effective area impulse activation system. The game captures the dramatic intensity of the Battle of Le Bourget and its desperate house to house fighting. 
Added chromes include random event cards featuring historical events players may use to influence the outcome of the battle. 
Units are companies of elite Prussian Guards, facing determined French Regulars and National Guardsmen in a fight to the finish and for a matter of honor.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mothership: Beyond the Expanse
Description:
Wondrous sights await you as you explore Beyond the Expanse. Tales are told of Pirates, space dwelling aliens, merchant traders and planets that are covered in giant sprawling cities. This miniatures-focused expansion pack will add a variety of ways to increase your presence in the galaxy and more ways to gain Victory Points.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monkeelaus: En la búsqueda del Piojo Dorado
Description:
In the Jadu Jungle live The Monkeelaus, a gang of Pipiopos monkeys who are fans of adventures, fruits and parties. Paala is one of them and she will be having a birthday soon. Her friends want her to have an unforgettable birthday party.

The best gift in the whole jungle is a tasty golden louse, but the only way to get one is to venture deep into the jungle and get to where a grumpy Giant Gorilla lives.

Fortunately, the jungle is full of friendly animals that will help the Monkeelaus on their tasty jungle adventure.

Monkeelaus – En la búsqueda del Piojo Dorado ("Monkeelaus in the quest of the golden louse") is a collaborative game that is played in two chapters: Paala's birthday and The best gift in the world.

Paala's birthday is a group challenge game. Players must overcome entertaining and crazy jungle challenges to get 5 pieces of cake, before 4 banana peels come out.
The best gift in the world is a strategy game. Players must get fruits in the jungle to exchange the Gorilla for one of its coveted golden lice and take it to Paala before time or fruit runs out.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mon Royaume pour un conte
Description:
Play with your children in the wonderful world of fairy tales.

You will first have to build your Kingdom by selecting the places that make it up, the monsters that haunt it and the heroes that inhabit it. This phase is played in draft. Then you will try to reconstruct the plot that is woven into it, among the 15 tales proposed. You will place your tiles according to the constraints specified in the game rules to build your story.

It is now up to the Bard of the Kingdom to tell the tale of your exploits, from castle to castle. This is how the adventures of your heroes will pass through the ages and perhaps become legendary.

The winner will then tell the story he made, either by making it up, or by reading the suggestions on the back of the objective cards.
